title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Tuesday, 19 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: the leader of huntingdonshire district council says there will be plenty of challenges ahead , with news that raf bases at alconbury and molesworth are to be sold off to free up land for new homes .
cambridge councillors have unanimously agreed to start a consultation on whether a public space protection order should be introduced on punting touts .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for the day from the team here at cambridgeshire live .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow , with all the news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
you can contact us with your stories and .
time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: wisbech man on final leg of historic cross atlantic rowing challenge
text: a group of wounded military veterans attempting to row the atlantic are less than 1,000 miles ( 1,609km ) away from earning a place in the history books .
author: Fenland Citizen

documents.title: weather : sharp frost tonight and freezing fog possible
text: although it 's likely to not be quite as cold as last night , expect a sharp frost tonight , even in built-up areas , and there may be some freezing fog .
minimum temperature : -3c ( 27f ) .
tomorrow will start frosty and we should have a cold but largely sunny day .
maximum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
for the latest updates , go to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: councillor criticised for his 'doom and gloom ' attack on parker 's piece ice rink
text: parker 's piece is `` for the enjoyment of the people of cambridge '' and the north pole christmas attraction provided that - according to the secretary of the south petersfield residents ' association .
frank gawthorpe criticised councillor tim bick for his `` doom and gloom '' response , after he said the park had been left `` a scene of devastation '' .

documents.title: cancer research uk to be cambridge-oxford boat race charity partner
text: the annual boat races between cambridge and oxford universities is to be renamed the cancer research uk boat races .
bny mellon and newton investment management have agreed to donate their title sponsorship to the charity for the next two years .
this year 's men 's and women 's races on the river thames will take place on 27 march .

documents.title: headlines : fatal ramsey house fire 'not sus march mayor praises anglian water for fixing town centre leak
text: here are the headlines for cambridgeshire this teatime :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: ramsey fatal house fire 'non sus say police
text: a fatal ramsey house fire is `` being treated as non-sus police have confirmed .
the body of an elderly woman was found in a semi-detached house in star lane early this morning .
cambridgeshire fire and rescue said the blaze was put out by 07:50 .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: men arrested by armed police in peterborough released without charge
text: two men arrested by armed police officers in lincoln road , peterborough yesterday have been released without charge .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: hot air balloon landing in bassingbourn school
text: this is the moment the hot air balloon landed at bassingbourn primary school this morning , captured by parent charlotte perkin .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: world war two veteran remembers bitter cold of arctic convoys
text: a royal naval gunner says his time on the arctic convoys during world war two was the worst experience of his five years ' service because it was `` so , so cold '' .

jack millard ( above , in about 1941 ) , who lives in hemingford grey , said : `` you could n't get warm and if you took your glove off and put it on a piece of metal , you would n't have any skin left . ''
he has just received the medal of ushakov from the russian government , which is honouring arctic convoy veterans for their role in supplying crucial supplies to the soviet union .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: travel : a1101 reopens
text: the a1101 welney causeway has re-opened in both directions .
as this shows , the road was closed for more than a week because of flooding .

documents.title: bassingbourn school 's 'exciting ' hot air balloon landing
text: we 've heard some more from bassingbourn primary school , where staff and children watched the single-person hopper balloon - a hot air balloon that does not have a basket - land close to the playground this morning .
`` the playground was packed with children and parents so we moved them all away once we realised he really was heading towards us , '' said headteacher sue brown .
`` it really was quite exciting . ''
`` i just walked over to him and said , 'hello , can we help you ? '
but he said he 'd already radioed his friends , who turned up and after about an hour he and the balloon were gone . ''
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: hot air balloon lands on bassingbourn school playground
text: children in bassingbourn were startled when a hot air balloon made an `` unscheduled landing '' at their school this morning .
the man and balloon landed on the playground at 08:40 `` just as the bell was ringing '' , according to headteacher sue brown .
`` i do n't think he meant to land here but it made the children 's day , '' she added .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: march bridge reopens after leak is repaired
text: the town bridge in march has reopened after a burst water main led to the closure of broad street .
as first reported in the march times , water supplies to part of the town were cut-off after the leak and the road was closed .
water was cascading down the underside of the bridge - but anglian water said teams had `` worked through the night '' to carry out repairs .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: frost and ice this morning in hinxton
text: there was widespread frost this morning across cambridgeshire , as seen here in hinxton .
and it 's feeling very cold .
for the latest weather updates go to bbc weather .
author: Sara Varey
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weymouth 's pitch 'looking good ' ahead of cambridge city trip
text: cambridge city 's trip to weymouth in the southern premier tonight is currently set to go ahead as planned .
the terrars say their pitch is looking good .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: headlines : woman dies in ramsey house fire march town bridge back in action after leak fixed
text: here are your headlines for cambridgeshire this lunchtime :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: ​cyclist and child hit by a car - but elderly motorist drove off after accident on cambridge bridge
text: a cyclist and a child were injured after being hit by a car - but the elderly motorist drove off after the accident on a bridge in cambridge .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: glorious sunrise captured in march
text: this was the sunrise over the middle level commissioner 's office in march this morning .
got a gorgeous pic you want to share with us ?
please send them to us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: parker 's piece is 'scene of devastation ' following christmas ice rink
text: the liberal democrat former leader of cambridge city council , tim bick , has described parker 's piece as `` a scene of devastation '' , after the closure of the north pole christmas attraction and ice rink .
about 40,000 people visited the attraction in the city centre , according to the labour-run council and that - with the wet weather - left the turf completely churned up .
icebox entertainment , which ran the event , will meet the cost of the repairs .
author: Steve Jackson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: fire cause 'unexplained ' after woman dies in ramsey blaze
text: the cause of a fatal ramsey fire is currently unexplained , according to cambridgeshire police .
the body of an elderly woman was found in a semi-detached house in star lane early this morning .
cambridgeshire fire and rescue said the blaze was put out by 07:50 .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: woman dies in house fire in ramsey
text: the body of an elderly woman was found earlier this morning after a house fire in ramsey .
cambridgeshire fire and rescue said crews from ramsey , stanground and whittlesey were called out at 06:29 .
the house on star lane was `` well alight '' by the time they arrived , a spokesman said .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: breakingfatal house fire reported in ramsey
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue has confirmed there 's been a fatal house fire in ramsey .
it will be giving us more details as soon as possible .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: council tax support in peterborough frozen for next year
text: support for some of the poorest residents in peterborough to pay their council tax is being frozen for another year at a reduction of 30 % .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: arctic convoy veterans receive russian naval medal
text: a russian military attache has been visiting world war two arctic convoy veterans and presenting them with a russian naval medal .
former gunner jack millard from hemingford grey received his medal last week .
the retired united dairies manager said he was amazed to receive the medal of ushakov , a soviet-era award named after russian admiral fyodor ushakov who `` never lost a battle '' .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: stand-off as bailiffs evict woman with cancer from houseboat in cambridge
text: bailiffs were called in yesterday to evict a couple from the river in cambridge , sparking protests and claims the action was putting a woman 's health at risk .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: raf molesworth housing plans would create 'middle of nowhere development '
text: government plans to sell the raf base at molesworth for housing would create a `` middle of nowhere development '' , according to the leader of huntingdonshire district council .

conservative councillor jason ablewhite said the base is 15 miles from huntingdon and 10 miles from thrapston , and it will be a `` huge , huge challenge '' to `` make that sustainable with access on the a14 '' .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: armed police arrest men in peterborough after member of the public reported spotting a firearm
text: two men have been arrested in peterborough after reports of a firearm seen in a car .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: consultation gets under way to ban punt touts
text: councillors have agreed to start a consultation on whether to ban punt touts from much of cambridge city centre .
under the proposals , it would be illegal for touts to operate around areas including the market square and king 's parade .
punt operators who spoke at last night 's meeting say this will put them out of business and have asked for alternatives to be considered .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: 'super-sized ' primary and secondary schools for cambridgeshire to deal with rapid population growth
text: super-sized schools could become the norm across cambridgeshire as the county 's rapid growth continues to put the squeeze on our under pressure public services .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: 'proof ' spider-man is not real , according to scientists
text: if spider-man was real , he would be forever falling off vertical walls and struggling to maintain credibility as a superhero , according to new research from cambridge university .

scientists at the university 's zoology department found the adhesive footpads that make spiders and geckos such amazing climbers are limited by body size and would n't work for humans , unless they had impossibly large feet .
the discovery is important , as it may have implications for the feasibility of large-scale gecko-like adhesive systems .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work begins on damaged turf at parker 's piece
text: work to renovate the grass on parker 's piece in cambridge has begun following the closure of the north pole christmas attraction .
thousands of people visited it over christmas , and this , combined with the wet weather , caused a lot of damage to the turf , the cambridge news reported .
cambridge city council said the full cost of the repairs will be met by the operator and it 's hoping the ground will be fully recovered by late spring .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: challenges posed by raf bases sell-off , says council leader
text: the leader of huntingdonshire district council says there 'll be plenty of challenges ahead , following the announcement the raf bases at alconbury and molesworth are to be sold off for housing .
jason ablewhite , conservative , says molesworth could effectively be a `` standalone town '' .
raf mildenhall , near newmarket , is also among the 12 raf and navy bases being sold .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : dry and sunny , but cold day
text: there will be a widespread sharp frost at first .
many places will have a dry and sunny day with just a few patches of cloud .
however , it will still feel very cold , despite the light winds .
maximum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: latest news : council leader warns of challenges following raf base sell-off consultation on punting touts
text: here 's this morning 's news in cambridgeshire :
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: travel : welney wash road remains shut
text: the a1101 welney wash road remains closed in both directions between old bedford river and new bedford river because of flooding .
no other major problems to report .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: hello and welcome to cambridgeshire live .
between now and 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .
author: David Keller
BBC News
